languageTools.program.agent.rules

Class RuleSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • languageTools.program.agent.rules.RuleSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>, java.lang.Iterable<Rule>

    public class RuleSet
extends ParsedObject
implements java.lang.Iterable<Rule>
    Container for the rules in the program{} section. Given a mental state (and debugger), this will also determine what rule will be the next one to fire according to the internal RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder.
    Author:
    K.Hindriks, N.Kraayenbrink; extracted from Agent. Added option for random or linear rule evaluation.
    Added macro support 4dec09
    Rule evaluation has moved to goal.core.agent.instructions.* feb11
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      static class  RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder
      The different orders in which the rules of an RuleSet can be evaluated.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RuleSet

        public RuleSet(RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder order,
       InputStreamPosition source)
        Creates an empty RuleSet of Rules, with a given RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder, i.e. a rule evaluation order.
        Parameters:
        order - The order in which the rules in the new rule set are evaluated and executed. May be overridden with setOptions(goal.util.BracketedOptions).
        source - The source code location of this action, if available; null otherwise.

      • setRuleOrder

        public void setRuleOrder(RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder ruleOrder)
        Set the order in which the rules in this RuleSet will be evaluated.
        Parameters:
        ruleOrder - The rule evaluation order.

      • setOptions

        public void setOptions(BracketedOptions options)
        Set the options for this set of rules.

        A RuleSet only has one option that can be set, the rule evaluation order set with the key order of a program section in a module. The values for this key are fixed by the RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder class.

        An invalid value is ignored, although a warning is generated.

        Parameters:
        options - A parsed list of options.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<Rule> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<Rule>
        Returns:
        An Iterator over the set of action rules this RuleSet contains.

      • applySubst

        public RuleSet applySubst(Substitution substitution)
        Instantiates the rules in this RuleSet with the given substitution.
        Parameters:
        substitution - The Substitution to apply to the rules.
        Returns:
        A new RuleSet with the same RuleSet.RuleEvaluationOrder as this RuleSet, but whose Rules have been instantiated with the given Substitution (using Rule.applySubst(Substitution)).

      • getActionOptions

        public final java.util.List<ActionCombo> getActionOptions(MentalState mentalState,
                                           Debugger debugger)
        Returns the actions that can be performed in the agent's current mental state (extracted from the run state).

        Only supports linear and random rule evaluation orders, but not the 'all' orders; i.e., linearall or randomall are not supported.

        In case of the 'linear' modes only returns the options generated by the first rule that is applicable. In case of the 'random' modes all options for every rule that is applicable are returned.

        Parameters:
        mentalState - The mental state used for evaluating the action options.
        debugger - The current debugger.
        Returns:
        A list of actions that may be performed in the given mental state, possibly empty.

      • run

        public Result run(RunState<?> runState,
         Substitution substitution)
        Executes this RuleSet.
        Parameters:
        runState - The run state in which the rule set is executed.
        substitution - The substitution provided by the module context that is passed on to this rule set.
        Returns:
        The Result of executing this rule set.
        Throws:
        KRQueryFailedException - FIXME: enable learner to deal with Rule#isSingleGoal

        public java.lang.String toString(java.lang.String linePrefix)
        Generalization of toString(). Allows the same method to be used for various indentation levels.
        Parameters:
        linePrefix - What to add in front of every line. Usually some amount of tabs or spaces.
        Returns:
        A string-representation of this set of (action) rules.
